pre_existing_conditions.conditions: acute onset of a pre-existing medical condition

eligibility_criteria: The insured person must be a resident of Singapore.

The insured person does not have any medical condition or symptom which they have not consulted a doctor for or for which they are waiting for medical test, medical result, diagnosis, treatment or surgery.
meet all conditions of cover

the or place of business in Singapore being unfit to live in or being seriously damaged following a burglary, fire, flood, typhoon, earthquake or landslip which means the insured person has to stay in Singapore
closing of airport or airspace that prevents the insured person from beginning the scheduled journey
The insured person is following their treating doctor pre-existing medical condition.
named driver or co-driver of the rental vehicle

natural disasters which happen at the planned overseas destination which prevent the insured person from beginning the scheduled journey
travel itinerary

You must have fully paid all outstanding premiums to the previous insurer based on the short period rate for the previous policy and we must have a copy of written confirmation from the previous insurer to prove this before our cover starts.
unexpected strike, industrial action, riot, civil commotion at the planned overseas destination which prevent the insured person from beginning the scheduled journey

Singaporean or PR

kept to all requirements of the rental agreement
The insured person must be between 18 and 65 years old.

In the last 12 months, the insured person does not have any pre-existing medical condition which has required them to: a) receive treatment at a hospital b) stay in a hospital as an inpatient for more than three days in a row; and c) stay in a hospital as an inpatient for more than once.
the insured person is denied boarding of the public transport by the local authority or transport provider due to infectious disease symptoms

travel_cancellation.description: Cancellation of trip due to unforeseen circumstances

baggage_loss.description: Loss or theft of baggage during the journey

accidental_death.description: We will pay the compensation for death or disability as described in the Table of Compensation below if an insured person suffers an injury during the journey which, within 12 calendar months of its happening, is the only cause of death or disability.

public_transport_double_cover.description: If the insured person suffers an injury while travelling as a fare-paying passenger on board any public transport outside Singapore during the journey which, within 12 calendar months of its happening, is the only cause of death, the amount we will pay will be double the limit for death provided under section 1 - Accidental death and permanent total disability.

funeral_expenses.description: If the insured person suffers an injury during the journey outside Singapore which, within 12 calendar months of its happening, is the only cause of their death, we will reimburse the reasonable expenses paid for their funeral or burial.

child_education_grant.description: If an adult insured person suffers an injury during the journey outside Singapore which, within 12 calendar months of its happening, is the only cause of their death, we will pay each of their biological children or legally adopted children, an amount as shown below.

family_assistance_benefit.description: If an insured person suffers an injury during the journey outside Singapore which, within 12 calendar months of its happening, is the only cause of their death, we will pay a lump-sum benefit shown below.

emergency_medical_evacuation_and_repatra.description: Emergency medical evacuation and repatriation services

emergency_telephone_charges.description: We will refund the actual telephone charges for using a personal mobile phone to contact our appointed assistance company.

child_guard.description: We will pay for the reasonable travel expenses for one family member or relative to travel overseas to accompany the children back to Singapore.

compassionate_and_hospital_visit.description: We will pay for the reasonable travel expenses for one adult member of the insured person's immediate family to travel from Singapore to be with the insured person.

emergency_medical_evacuation.description: We will pay for emergency medical evacuation up to $1,000,000 per insured person for any one journey.

insolvency_of_licensed_travel_operator.description: We will pay for the loss of travel fares or travel deposits paid by the insured person which cannot be recovered from any other source.

hijack_of_public_transport.description: Delay of public transport due to hijack.

wedding_clothing_and_accessories.description: Premier Plan: $3,500 for each adult insured person. Elite Plan: $2,500 for each adult insured person. Standard Plan: Not covered.

loss_of_travel_documents.description: Premier Plan: $5,000 for each insured person, $10,000 in total for adult and children cover or family cover. Elite Plan: $3,000 for each insured person, $6,000 in total for adult and children cover or family cover. Standard Plan: $2,000 for each insured person, $4,000 in total for adult and children cover or family cover.

personal_money.description: Premier Plan: $500 for each insured person, $500 in total for adult and children cover or family cover. Elite Plan: $300 for each insured person, $300 in total for adult and children cover or family cover. Standard Plan: $100 for each insured person, $100 in total for adult and children cover or family cover.

fraudulent_use_of_credit_card.description: Premier Plan: $3,000 for each adult insured person. Elite Plan: $2,000 for each adult insured person. Standard Plan: Not covered.

credit_card_outstanding_balance.description: Premier Plan: $3,000 for each adult insured person. Elite Plan: $2,000 for each adult insured person. Standard Plan: Not covered.

personal_liability.description: Premier Plan: $1,000,000 for each adult insured person, $500,000 for each insured child, $1,000,000 in total for adult and children cover or family cover. Elite Plan: $1,000,000 for each adult insured person, $500,000 for each insured child, $1,000,000 in total for adult and children cover or family cover. Standard Plan: $500,000 for each adult insured person, $250,000 for each insured child, $500,000 in total for adult and children cover or family cover.

return_rental_vehicle.description: Reasonable costs for returning the rental vehicle to the nearest hire depot.

home_contents.description: Physical loss or damage to home contents within their home in Singapore.

domestic_pets_care.description: Extended stay of domestic pets due to injury or illness of the insured person.

terrorism_cover.description: Losses suffered through acts of terrorism.

passive_war.description: Death or bodily injury through war, riot, revolution or any similar event.

kidnap_and_hostage.description: Kidnap and hostage is not covered under this policy.

requirements: Insured person must stay in a registered hospital as a registered inpatient because of a medical need and on the advice of a doctor.
The medical expenses must be incurred within 30 days of the incident.
written confirmation of the nature of the serious injury or serious illness from a doctor
The insured person must be hospitalised due to illness or injury.
original receipts
inpatient hospital charges only
Medical certificate from a doctor
The insured person must be hospitalized for at least 5 days.
Insured person must be hospitalised within 24 hours after returning to Singapore due to an injury or illness suffered during the overseas journey.
Written confirmation from a doctor is required for serious injury or illness
medical report or certificate from a doctor
Medical report
Hospital bill
exclusions: prosthesis
Any restrictions or regulations imposed by any government or local authority.
dental treatment
Pre-existing medical conditions are not covered under this policy.

Radioactive contamination, chemical, biological, biochemical and electromagnetic weapons exclusion This clause will override anything in this insurance which says differently. We will not cover loss, damage, liability or expense directly or indirectly caused by or contributed to by or arising from: a) ionising radiations from or contamination by radioactivity from any nuclear fuel or from any nuclear waste from burning nuclear fuel; b) the radioactive, toxic, explosive or other dangerous properties of any nuclear installation, reactor or other nuclear machinery; c) any weapon or device using atomic or nuclear fission or fusion or other similar reaction or radioactive force or matter; or d) the radioactive, toxic, explosive or other dangerous properties of any radioactive matter. This exclusion does not apply to radioactive isotopes, other than nuclear fuel, when these
Medical expenses incurred in Singapore
War and terrorism
Any pre-existing medical condition unless covered under section 52 Pre-Ex Critical Care.
Childbirth, miscarriage, abortion, menopause or any pregnancy related conditions with exception to cover under section 11 Maternity medical expenses overseas.
items covered under section 35 Loss of Travel Documents

The cost of any non-emergency treatment or surgery you choose to have, including exploratory tests, which are not directly related to the illness or injury which required the insured person hospital; b) any form of cosmetic surgery or treatment; c) any expenses in respect of normal dental inspection or treatment or in obtaining dentures, retainer; d) eyeglasses or the like, hearing aids, prosthesis, corrective devices; e) treatment or service provided by a health spa, convalescent or nursing home or any rehabilitation centre; f) any claim if the insured person is under treatment not recommended by or carried out by a doctor, dentist or TCM practitioner; or g) any claim if the insured person is travelling against the advice of a doctor or for the purpose of getting medical treatment during the journey.
Any consequential loss not shown in the policy.
Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV), HIV related illnesses, or any other diseases or illnesses related to sexually transmitted disease.
mobility aids
Pre-existing medical conditions
Section 13 - Overseas ICU hospitalisation daily benefit

The insured person taking part in the following activities unless covered under section 41 Adventurous Activities Cover: a) flying or other aerial activities except travelling as a fare-paying passenger in a properly licensed, regular scheduled commercial airline operating between licensed commercial airports; b) rafting or canoeing involving white-water rapids, jet skiing, high diving or jumping, free diving, underwater activities involving artificial breathing apparatus; c) bungee jumping, sky-diving, paragliding; d) winter sports, or any activities involving the use of a bobsleigh or skeleton; e) hunting, potholing, mountaineering that normally involves using ropes, rock climbing unless harnessed and done on man-made walls, hiking or trekking; f) speed or time trials, competitions, marathon, triathlon, ultra-marathon, sprints or racing of any kind, or as a professional sportsperson (where you could earn income, pay or sponsorship from taking part in that sport or activity) or any organised team football; g) extreme sports which involve speed, height, danger, a high level of physical exertion, highly specialised gear or special stunts; h) manual work of any kind unless you tell us when applying for the insurance and we accept this in writing; or i) expeditions or crewing a vessel from one country to another or taking part in active service in the armed forces of any nation.
Self-inflicted injuries

Suicide or attempted suicide, intentional self-inflicted injury or any act which could reasonably be considered as exposure to danger (unless carried out in an attempt to save human life), insanity, or while the insured person is under the influence of alcohol, drugs or other substance abuse (other than drugs taken under medical supervision and not to treat drug addiction).
Any deliberate, malicious, criminal or unlawful acts committed by you or the insured person or any person acting on your or their behalf.

The insured person taking part in naval, military, air force, civil defence or police services or operations, testing of any kind of vehicle or transport, while taking part in off-shore or in mining, aerial imaging or handling explosives, ammunitions or firearms, or travelling as an operator or crew member of any public transport.
Section 14 - Hospitalisation daily benefit in Singapore
Pre-existing medical condition that worsens within the 30 days before the start of the trip
Any mental illness, anxiety state or depression suffered by the insured person and diagnosed before arranging the journey.
Terminal illness
Outpatient medical treatment

War and terrorism exclusion This insurance will not cover death, disability, loss, damage, destruction, any legal liabilities, cost or expense including consequential loss of whatever nature, directly or indirectly caused by, resulting from or in connection with any of the following, no matter whether there is any other cause or event contributing at the same time or in any other sequence to the loss. a) War, invasion, act of foreign enemy or warlike operations (whether declared or not), riot, civil war, revolution, civil commotion assuming the proportions of or amounting to any uprising, military or usurped power or any similar event. b) Any act of terrorism including but not limited to: i) the use or threat of force or violence; or ii) harm or damage to life or to property (or the threat of harm or damage) including, but not limited to, nuclear radiation or contamination by chemical or biological agents, by any person or group committed for political, religious, ideological or similar purposes, with the intention of putting the public or any section of the public in fear; or c) Any action taken in controlling, preventing, suppressing or in any way relating to (a) or (b) above. If we say your claim is not covered as a result of this exclusion, you will need to prove to us otherwise to pay the claim.

damage to any computer or other equipment, component, system or item which processes, stores, sends or retrieves data, including loss or corruption of data (including any information or programs or software) and whether your property or not, if the damage is caused by programming or operator error, virus or similar, or hacking; consequential loss directly or indirectly caused by or arising from general exclusion 16 (a) above; COVID-19 and pandemics exclusion; Cyber exclusion; Political risks exclusion; Property Cyber and data exclusion
Any known event.
items covered under section 34 Wedding clothing and accessories

{'requirements': ['Insured person must stay in a registered hospital as a registered inpatient because of a medical need and on the advice of a doctor.', 'The medical expenses must be incurred within 30 days of the incident.', 'written confirmation of the nature of the serious injury or serious illness from a doctor', 'The insured person must be hospitalised due to illness or injury.', 'original receipts', 'inpatient hospital charges only', 'Medical certificate from a doctor', 'The insured person must be hospitalized for at least 5 days.', 'Insured person must be hospitalised within 24 hours after returning to Singapore due to an injury or illness suffered during the overseas journey.', 'Written confirmation from a doctor is required for serious injury or illness', 'medical report or certificate from a doctor', 'Medical report', 'Hospital bill'], 'exclusions': ['prosthesis', 'Any restrictions or regulations imposed by any government or local authority.', 'dental treatment', 'Pre-existing medical conditions are not covered under this policy.', 'Radioactive contamination, chemical, biological, biochemical and electromagnetic weapons exclusion This clause will override anything in this insurance which says differently. We will not cover loss, damage, liability or expense directly or indirectly caused by or contributed to by or arising from: a) ionising radiations from or contamination by radioactivity from any nuclear fuel or from any nuclear waste from burning nuclear fuel; b) the radioactive, toxic, explosive or other dangerous properties of any nuclear installation, reactor or other nuclear machinery; c) any weapon or device using atomic or nuclear fission or fusion or other similar reaction or radioactive force or matter; or d) the radioactive, toxic, explosive or other dangerous properties of any radioactive matter. This exclusion does not apply to radioactive isotopes, other than nuclear fuel, when these', 'Medical expenses incurred in Singapore', 'War and terrorism', 'Any pre-existing medical condition unless covered under section 52 Pre-Ex Critical Care.', 'Childbirth, miscarriage, abortion, menopause or any pregnancy related conditions with exception to cover under section 11 Maternity medical expenses overseas.', 'items covered under section 35 Loss of Travel Documents', 'The cost of any non-emergency treatment or surgery you choose to have, including exploratory tests, which are not directly related to the illness or injury which required the insured person hospital; b) any form of cosmetic surgery or treatment; c) any expenses in respect of normal dental inspection or treatment or in obtaining dentures, retainer; d) eyeglasses or the like, hearing aids, prosthesis, corrective devices; e) treatment or service provided by a health spa, convalescent or nursing home or any rehabilitation centre; f) any claim if the insured person is under treatment not recommended by or carried out by a doctor, dentist or TCM practitioner; or g) any claim if the insured person is travelling against the advice of a doctor or for the purpose of getting medical treatment during the journey.', 'Any consequential loss not shown in the policy.', 'Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV), HIV related illnesses, or any other diseases or illnesses related to sexually transmitted disease.', 'mobility aids', 'Pre-existing medical conditions', 'Section 13 - Overseas ICU hospitalisation daily benefit', 'The insured person taking part in the following activities unless covered under section 41 Adventurous Activities Cover: a) flying or other aerial activities except travelling as a fare-paying passenger in a properly licensed, regular scheduled commercial airline operating between licensed commercial airports; b) rafting or canoeing involving white-water rapids, jet skiing, high diving or jumping, free diving, underwater activities involving artificial breathing apparatus; c) bungee jumping, sky-diving, paragliding; d) winter sports, or any activities involving the use of a bobsleigh or skeleton; e) hunting, potholing, mountaineering that normally involves using ropes, rock climbing unless harnessed and done on man-made walls, hiking or trekking; f) speed or time trials, competitions, marathon, triathlon, ultra-marathon, sprints or racing of any kind, or as a professional sportsperson (where you could earn income, pay or sponsorship from taking part in that sport or activity) or any organised team football; g) extreme sports which involve speed, height, danger, a high level of physical exertion, highly specialised gear or special stunts; h) manual work of any kind unless you tell us when applying for the insurance and we accept this in writing; or i) expeditions or crewing a vessel from one country to another or taking part in active service in the armed forces of any nation.', 'Self-inflicted injuries', 'Suicide or attempted suicide, intentional self-inflicted injury or any act which could reasonably be considered as exposure to danger (unless carried out in an attempt to save human life), insanity, or while the insured person is under the influence of alcohol, drugs or other substance abuse (other than drugs taken under medical supervision and not to treat drug addiction).', 'Any deliberate, malicious, criminal or unlawful acts committed by you or the insured person or any person acting on your or their behalf.', 'The insured person taking part in naval, military, air force, civil defence or police services or operations, testing of any kind of vehicle or transport, while taking part in off-shore or in mining, aerial imaging or handling explosives, ammunitions or firearms, or travelling as an operator or crew member of any public transport.', 'Section 14 - Hospitalisation daily benefit in Singapore', 'Pre-existing medical condition that worsens within the 30 days before the start of the trip', 'Any mental illness, anxiety state or depression suffered by the insured person and diagnosed before arranging the journey.', 'Terminal illness', 'Outpatient medical treatment', 'War and terrorism exclusion This insurance will not cover death, disability, loss, damage, destruction, any legal liabilities, cost or expense including consequential loss of whatever nature, directly or indirectly caused by, resulting from or in connection with any of the following, no matter whether there is any other cause or event contributing at the same time or in any other sequence to the loss. a) War, invasion, act of foreign enemy or warlike operations (whether declared or not), riot, civil war, revolution, civil commotion assuming the proportions of or amounting to any uprising, military or usurped power or any similar event. b) Any act of terrorism including but not limited to: i) the use or threat of force or violence; or ii) harm or damage to life or to property (or the threat of harm or damage) including, but not limited to, nuclear radiation or contamination by chemical or biological agents, by any person or group committed for political, religious, ideological or similar purposes, with the intention of putting the public or any section of the public in fear; or c) Any action taken in controlling, preventing, suppressing or in any way relating to (a) or (b) above. If we say your claim is not covered as a result of this exclusion, you will need to prove to us otherwise to pay the claim.', 'damage to any computer or other equipment, component, system or item which processes, stores, sends or retrieves data, including loss or corruption of data (including any information or programs or software) and whether your property or not, if the damage is caused by programming or operator error, virus or similar, or hacking; consequential loss directly or indirectly caused by or arising from general exclusion 16 (a) above; COVID-19 and pandemics exclusion; Cyber exclusion; Political risks exclusion; Property Cyber and data exclusion', 'Any known event.', 'items covered under section 34 Wedding clothing and accessories']}

contributing at the same time or in any other sequence to the loss. a) War, invasion, act of foreign enemy or warlike operations (whether declared or not), riot, civil war, revolution, civil commotion assuming the proportions of or amounting to any uprising, military or usurped power or any similar event. b) Any act of terrorism including but not limited to: i) the use or threat of force or violence; or ii) harm or damage to life or to property (or the threat of harm or damage) including, but not limited to, nuclear radiation or contamination by chemical or biological agents, by any person or group committed for political, religious, ideological or similar purposes, with the intention of putting the public or any section of the public in fear; or c) Any action taken in controlling, preventing, suppressing or in any way relating to (a) or (b) above. If we say your claim is not covered as a result of this exclusion, you will need to prove to us otherwise to pay the claim.', 'damage to any computer or other equipment, component, system or item which processes, stores, sends or retrieves data, including loss or corruption of data (including any information or programs or software) and whether your property or not, if the damage is caused by programming or operator error, virus or similar, or hacking; consequential loss directly or indirectly caused by or arising from general exclusion 16 (a) above; COVID-19 and pandemics exclusion; Cyber exclusion; Political risks exclusion; Property Cyber and data exclusion', 'Any known event.', 'items covered under section 34 Wedding clothing and accessories']}
